page.title: 02Population
page.content: Hove has a high number of old people. In 1981 31.7% were pensioners.Whilst population falls,number of pensioners increased and number of young children fallen dramatically by 29.6%.High concentration of old puts pressure on certain services such as doctors.In Wish ward alone there were 111 old peoples homes in 1981.Demand has been created for sheltered housing where the old may be cared for .Loneliness is a problem.24.8% of households are occupied by 1 pensioner.57.8% of households are owner occupied & 13.1% local authority owned houses very low in comparison to England.Local authority housing highest in Hangleton with 44.3% council owned.51.2% of the population are economically active. Hove has the lowest economic activity figure for men in England.In 1981 unemployment was 4.3%,mainly below 30.
